Description:
Hi, I'd like to update all my hosts to latest 5.5 version as well as my Vcenter server but I'd like to avoid the use of a web console.

There are some features and usability that we prefer to keep in the client that is why we prefer not to use a web client but continue using Vsphere stand Alone client. is this possible?
GSS_Resolution__c: Customer did not reply

Description:
Patching Remote Commands failing to run intermittingly (mostly fail) at some remote locations in our Asia Pacific region.  Sometimes the stage jobs will run, sometimes (mostly) fail with a variety of errors like "crspiConnectionMachineHttpStartup.PushFile()  HRESULT 0x00002f78;" and "crspiConnectionMachineHttpStartup.PushFile()  HRESULT 0x80004005 = Unspecified error;".

I have uninstalled and re-installed the agents on these servers.  They are all 2008r2 machines, the agents are configured for HTTP and mutual authentication is working, so, no certificate issues.  Collections run without issues.  But, when creating a patch job, when the patching remote command job begins, they mostly fail almost instantly with these errors.

I captured debug logs with debug = 1 in the csi_hf_settings table.  I can email this information after contacted.
GSS_Resolution__c: issues possibly caused by internet outage in singapore

Description:
Hi there, we are after a bit of advice on the best possible route to upgrade vCenter from 5.1 to 5.5.

We currently run VC 5.1 in a separate management cluster protected by vCenter Heartbeat, as VC heartbeat is being deprecated we are looking to not use this. 

We currently use Windows Server 2008R2 and SQL 2008 for the servers, and would like to go to Windows 2012R2 and SQL 2012. 

Would you advise to carry out an in place upgrade on the existing server then look to migrate to a new Windows installation by copying across and restoring the SQL DB? 

Or copy and restore the SQL DB on a new Windows 2012 VC 5.5 install? 

Are key points are not to lose any vSphere historic Metrics or VM registrations. 

We also run the SSO and VC on seperate Windows and SQL installations but only have one vCenter instance. Would the recommendation be to consolidate into one Server?

Thanks

Ian.
GSS_Resolution__c: query answered.

Host OS : MAC OS X 10.10
Guest OS : Windows 7

Contact Number : 909 518 1906 , 909 463 0078

when i recompose a pool it failed with the message
View Composer Fault: Virtual Machine with input specifications already exists
GSS_Resolution__c: na

Description: We are planning to upgrade vcenter from 5.5 to 6 as we want to use vsphere replication 6 and currently are on 5.8. according to the inteopability guide it says 5.8 is NOT interoperable with 6, does this mean we lose what we have until we update replication to 6?
GSS_Resolution__c: Provided compatibility information

Description:
importing the vCenter navigator pack fails on one of the cluster nodes. it's does not add the default dashboards or ever complete data collection. this is a fresh build of 6.1 and the first import attempt

i have pulled a support bundle from vROPS
GSS_Resolution__c: No Response

Description: Not able to delete snapshots or consolidate disks of 5 VM's
GSS_Resolution__c: Remove CTK

Description: Our DR facility was working fine internally, no changes were recently made to this environment, now users are unable to connect to VIEW desktops in our DR site internally using HTML Blast, zero client or software client, I checked the servers all services are started, no drive space issues, no event log issues, the view dashboard is clean with no errors, servers have been rebooted yet the issue still remains, externally outside of our network users can connect to the Horizon VIEW desktops, the issue is only happening when trying to connect internally
GSS_Resolution__c: Found issue was DNS related.

Description:
Status in Admin Console incorrect. Console shows machines available but users are connected and working. Also unable to connect back to a disconnected session. 

thanks
Tony
GSS_Resolution__c: Hot patch provided to customer from engineering

Description: VM won't start due to lost of VMDKs after a snapshot attempt, vmx file possibly corrupted.
GSS_Resolution__c: VM was crashed during a snapshot process and now the snapshot is corrupt and VM does not startup. Re-pointed the vmdk to previous snapshot disks to resolve the issue.

Description: After patching host to v3343343 it no longer is visible to vCenter.  Other hosts are at v2718055.  Can access via vSphere client, but unable to connect to via vCenter Console.
GSS_Resolution__c: The problem is the one described in KB http://kb.vmware.com/kb/2140304.

Description:
We are trying to install vCenter server on our amazon web services instance on a windows server that is network attached. 
I have vCenter 6.0 installed on this server but my question is we want to test this new install of vCenter with a few of our esxi hosts. How can we do this? 
I've configured the new vCenter on the cloud server locally on that server and didn't attach it to the domain for feat that it might affect our on-prem vCenter server.
GSS_Resolution__c: Customer to configure routing between host and vCenter

Description:
Hello Team,

Please note this is for a Federation Enterprise Hybrid Cloud jointly supported by EMC and VMWare. An EMC SR#77307232, has been logged with us already.

 
??End User Company Name: EHEALTH SASKATCHEWAN
??Location: WHITE CITY, Canada

 

I am the EMC Case Coordinator logging the ticket on behalf of the end user. Additional emails will be provided in 'additional notes', please make sure to add those as additional stakeholders to the issue.

 

Please email all parties when requesting logs, screenshots, errors, or WebEx.

 

EMC currently classifies this as a Severity 2.

 

Here is a description:

 When running the Disaster Recovery Initialization Main workflow, there appears to be a vCO like pop-up that gives an option to select the SRM Protected or Recovery site. When we are filling in the Recovery Site details, the vCO like pop-up keeps showing us the protected site as our selection. We never have an option to choose the actual "recovery site". 

Also in the vco inventory tab, SRM plugin only shows protected site.  it should show both protected and recovery site. 

Which prevents user from select recovery site from the pull down menu (read from data from vco inventory, which is currently missing).

 of the EMC SR#77307232, which relates to this issue:
GSS_Resolution__c:
Customer resolved.
SSO was installed in the DR location instead of multisite

Description:
When Trying to launch a console to virtual machines i get "Unable to connect to the MKS: Internal error"

If i vmotion to another host i can then try and open the console.   I believe this is the same as article id:  "??Unable to open MKS: Internal Error?? when opening virtual machine console (2116542)"

Can you tell me if there is any fix for this other than VMotioning?  As well as when it will be resolved.
GSS_Resolution__c: No fix available as per KB 2116542

Description: We are unable to provision any new linked clones and we are also not able to recompose any machines I cannot look at the errors and evens as the page does not load
GSS_Resolution__c:
Cluster hosts have been upgraded to ESXi5.5U3B which disables SSLv3 - View 6.0.1 still requires SSLv3. Set to 72hr monitor, customer has decided to downrev hosts rather than open security risk on new version. More information here: http://blogs.vmware.com/vsphere/2015/12/sslv3-protocol-disabled-by-default-in-vsphere-5-5-update-3b.html
View Composer earlier than version 6.2 will have connection failures with ESXi 5.5 Update 3b. Refer to http://kb.vmware.com/kb/2121021

Description:
vSphere HA agent on this host is disabled.

The vDS corresponding to the proxy on the host does not exist in vCenter server.
GSS_Resolution__c: Provided recommemdations

Description: Le serveur vCenter 6 n'est pas fonctionnel. Les services Posgres, vmware vcenter etc... ne demarre plus. Il n'est pas possible de la d??marrer manuellement.
GSS_Resolution__c: port 80 was taken by Veeam One

Description:
After Rebooting the vCenter Server from the Web Page the vpxd Initialization Faild.

Webend ist reachable but there ist no Connection to the vCenter Server
GSS_Resolution__c: Customer is checking the Storage with his Storage Admin.

Hello
we need to retrieve within the sql server database a possibility to get the total path available per LUNS.
We are chaning our Cisco MDS9506 to MDS9706. In our check after the upgrade we need to easily if the total path is equal to 4 iso of 2

Krgds
GSS_Resolution__c: Provided query

Description:
An unexpected error was received from the ESX host while powering on VM vm-190.
Reason: The system cannot find the file specified.
Cannot open the disk 'New Virtual Machine.vmdk' or one of the snapshot disks it depends on. 
VMware ESX cannot find the virtual disk "New Virtual Machine.vmdk". Verify the path is valid and try again.
GSS_Resolution__c: recreate descriptor files

Description:
Hi support,

after deploying the new Usage Meter version 3.4 and migrating data from the existing Usage Meter, all the collections from the new UM failed. The firewall-rules are copied from the current Usage Meter appliance but there doesn't seem to be any traffic outgoing from the new instance. Please check the Support Bundle that I'm going to upload to your ftp.
Thanks.

Best regards
Michael
GSS_Resolution__c: the vCenter are register with FQDN, but DNS is not configure on UM

Description: Unable to configure replication for virtual machine 'DWHPROD.odsyhealth.com' because group 'DWHPROD.odsyhealth.com' cannot be created. Another virtual machine 'DWHPROD.odsyhealth.com' that has the same instance UUID '502d1826-df37-2811-b1eb-24503b522fbb' already exists on protection site 'lbvctr20.gentiva.ghsnet.com'.
GSS_Resolution__c: TSE provided solution that customer was able to implement during maintenance window that corrected replication VM.

Description: Purple screen of death on multiple servers in the environment. Attached are the screen shots of the errors. At the moment the server are stuck on
GSS_Resolution__c: Reboot the storage controller and failed over to the other storage controller

Description:

We have an issue where one of our VM's that is our Veeam Backup Proxy that is performing the backup of our entire VM estate, connection with the backup target that is a Synology NAS when the back takes a very long time (more than 24hrs backup). Thi s scenario usually happens when we are backing up SQL servers that are VM's.

We have run a continuous ping test from the Backup proxy to various VM's and the Nas and it seems that the various VM's also loose connection when they are being snapshot.

GSS_Resolution__c: recommendations provided

Description: We had a Production Server go down with a PSOD on 12/05/2014 at 6:00 PM CST.  The server is named PRCHSHES5022 and is version 5.0 U3 1489271.  None of the VMs were able to HA off onto the second host in the Cluster.  I rebooted the host and brought the VMs back up.  If you can tell us what the cause was and now to fix it, that would be greatly appreciated.  I uploaded a screenshot of the PSOD and the LOGs ot the FTP site under a folder named after the incident number.
GSS_Resolution__c:
An ESXi 5.x host running on HP server fails with a purple diagnostic screen and the error: hpsa_update_scsi_devices or detect_controller_lockup_thread (2075978) 
http://kb.vmware.com/kb/2075978

Description:
We received alert in vSphare Client:
Home -> Administration -> vCenter service status -> License Services -> License Usage History service - Cannot store license usage in the vCenter Server database.

We found VMware KB related directly to this kind of alert.
-> http://kb.vmware.com/selfservice/microsites/search.do?language=en_US&cmd=displayKC&externalId=1029495 
We applied this without any result. Alert is still there.

VMware vCenter Server 5.5.0, 2001466 version.
Database is on Oracle.
GSS_Resolution__c:
Restore DB and fresh install of VC worked in a Lab.

Reinstall VC should solve this issue
